meanings.definition: The act of organizing something again.
meanings.sent1: After the company's reorganizations, the office layout was completely different.
meanings.sent2: The reorganizations of the files made it easier to find important documents.
meanings.sent3: The reorganizations of the pantry shelves led to a hilarious mix-up of snacks.
meanings.sent4: Her reorganizations of the study space transformed it into a productive haven.
meanings.sent5: The reorganizations of the toy box turned chaos into order.

meanings.sent1: The reorganizations of the department took longer than expected.
meanings.sent2: Efficient reorganizations can streamline workflow in a business.
meanings.sent3: The reorganizations of the sock drawer seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent4: The reorganizations of the schedule brought a sense of clarity.
meanings.sent5: His reorganizations of the garden layout were meticulous and thoughtful.

meanings.sent1: The reorganizations of the team structure improved communication.
meanings.sent2: The reorganizations of the classroom setup created a more interactive environment.
meanings.sent3: The reorganizations of the closet resulted in a surprising discovery of old clothes.
meanings.sent4: The reorganizations of the city's infrastructure enhanced efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The reorganizations of the bookshelf made it look neat and tidy.
